39130281.review:
Oats Studios - Volume 1 Assets: сборник платных ассетов к фильмам студии Oats.

В бесплатной версии доступна только программка открывающая папку в которой будут ассеты после их покупки, и инструкции и прочая юридическая информация к ассетам (вообщем это намек что без покупки самих ассетов программа бесполезна).

Что интересна в самой программке написано, что открывается она ровно на 6 минут, чтобы потом можно было написать обзор. Чем собственно и воспользуемся. Сами фильмы очень годные, часть из них можно бесплатно посмотреть на официальной страничке студии на YouTube, на их сайте, а также в Стиме.

Если Вам понравились фильмы и Вы хотите поддержать студию денежкой, или Вам нужны ассеты из их фильмов (для каких-то целей), купить их можно.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1126176713

34582871.review: Its a shame he didn't get to make Aliens but my lord these are amazing. These shorts pack more content into 20+ minutes then a blockbuster packs into 3 movies, that includes the endings. The endings are great too not tying things off but giving just enough information to let the viewer decide if the conflicts will end in one's favor or not. It is like Japanese horror but made into action cinema. The special effects and story as well as sound design never cease to amaze. I like all of the shorts but so far Firebase stands out on top, the way everything is explained in more ways than I would ever expect to be explained in the time allotted.

33583754.review:
Experimental, creative, with high production values and good acting, Volume 1 is full of fantastic shorts.
These films manage to achieve a lot in such a short time.
Creating great atmospheres, building stories and introducing worlds and characters that as a viewer, I really want to see more of.

Zygote, a personal favourite, has a real SOMA-like feel to it that I particularly enjoyed.

The assets are well worth the purchase.
The concept art, script, models and behind the scenes info provide interesting insights into the creative process. 
The soundtrack is a great collection of atmospheric tracks from Lorne Balfe. 
The high-quality copies of the shorts (Firebase, Rakka and Zygote) provide a better way to enjoy rewatching them. If budget wasn't an issue, HDR versions would be a treat.

I hope we see more creative approaches to film-making like this.
I really hope that Oats garner enough support to continue their work on these and a Volume 2.
All the best to the Oats team!

33578689.review:
Stunning return to form from Neil Blomkamp. I always held up hope that he may have another "District 9" in him but this Oats Studios endeavour is so much cooler than a single feature.

Zygote in particular is a masterpiece of short form horror and contains a ridiculous amount of world building for a 22 minute film.

I am so looking forward to seeing what these guys make next and will support them all the way.

33551515.review:
Everything Oats Studios has put out so far has been incredible. This is the sort of unleashed creativity the film industry needs.

What's even more amazing is that this is pretty much Open Source film making. When you pay the $5 for the content you get a non-commercial license to use ALL of the content any way you want. That's unreal.

I really, *really* hope this goes somewhere and Oats keeps getting to make crazy new stuff for a long time. I would love to see any of the videos they've released become full movies, shows, or even games!

33550236.review:
Blu-ray quality files? No DRM? You mean, I can literally just download the movie and start watching it whenever I want, wherever I want, however I want? FUCK. YES. This is what the rest of the movie industry needs to be doing. Also, the quality on these files is noticeably better than the streamed versions, which are lower bitrate.

I'm not an animator, so the 3dsmax and maya files aren't much use to me. But I think it's fucking awesome that a professional studio is releasing material like that! Not just HQ final prints, unencumbered by DRM, but intermediate assets too? That's the way of the future.

Oats Studios definitely has my attention and they should have yours too.

P.S. - I'm on GNU/Linux, and launching the software just opened up an xterm. No biggie. I know where the files are at that point.

33543324.review:
The videos produced by Oats are amazing, cinema-quality showpieces designed with the clear intention of drawing interest in the studio and its works. If you enjoyed Rakka, Zygote or Firebase, and want to see more of that awesomeness, the cold hard truth is that you *need* to support the studio by purchasing the asset packs and soundtrack. Without our support they simply cannot afford to make more of this stuff. Neill Blomkamp said in a recent interview that Oats is bleeding out with the production costs of these things. Only through our financial support can his team make more. Even if you're never going to do anything with these assets, it's worth your money to pay for them. 

That said, actually releasing the real, legitimate assets used in the films is kind of an amazing thing that no other film studio has ever done before to my knowledge, in the history of film-making. They're providing us the with the actual CGI models that were used in the production of their movies. That's huge. I mean, that's a BIG deal! So if you're interested in making games, film/television production, or whatever, having access to those assets is an incredible resource.

WANT MORE OATS? BUY THE ASSET PACKS. Seriously. Do it. Hurry up.

33286757.review: Rakka Volume 1 is the exceptional first part of Neill Blomkamp's new film: a beautiful blend of Terminator & Aliens-esque atmosphere with some cracking set pieces & superb special effects, considering the small budget. With a run time of approximately 22 minutes it manages to quickly set the scene, mostly via use of a narrator, and delivers a world that I'm eager to revist in the following volumes. If you enjoyed his previous films then I urge you to support him & his crew by buying the high resoultion / surround sound copy which comes with some assets like some cool concept art and a script, the latter of which is due for release shortly. If you're on the fence you can head over to YouTube to see it for free, and if you're left wanting more then consider dropping a few quid. It's a damn shame this guy won't be bringing us his vision of the Aliens sequel; this is the next best thing.

Sorry Neil Blomkamp, love your work but this is not the right format.

32737811.review:
First of all... this is pretty much the equivalent of a pilot... a short made to show up an idea for a feature movie. So if you're looking for a complete story, you're not gonna get it. 

That said, it's still one of the best production samples and/or short movies I've seen. Takes a very interesting premise, which for some reason so far almost no proper movie or serie managed to got right, and rolls with it to the extreme. Lots of dark and bleak imagery, but also very well made and mesmerizing to watch. And the whole "alien lizardmen covered in nanites" design is something that I just love, both in concept and in execution. 

As for the content in the Assetts Pack... you get a very meaty digital artbook, a full quality downloadable version of the short itself, a digital copy of its script and a 3D-printable model of one of the aliens from the movie. All for less than the price of a movie ticket. 

If you like well made dark science-fiction, and want to support an indipendent studio that shows lots of promises when it comes to that, this is a purchase I very much recommend.

32666703.review:
Blomkamp and the crew at Oats Studios are making motion picture history. This kind of evaluation of movie ideas and concepts is just pure brilliance and the engagement with the audience directly gives immensely valuable data for further development.

But the most intriguing idea is to allow the fans to participate in the making by giving access to the assets and (later coming) dailies. I for one will definitely load all the dailies into the editor and cook up something goofy, like a Grindhouse version or something even more weird (I have some ideas in my backpocket). 

Having watched Rakka, I was just blown away with the quality and the whole concept. And will gladly pay the five bucks to see it in it's full glory. And I would gladly pay another five bucks to get the access to the dailies. 

Remixing and contribution is the thing today and I'm so excited to see it being applied the motion picture industry. Hats off to the folks at Oats Studios and especially to mr. Blomkamp! o/

32607857.review:
We all know Steam is great for digital distribution of games. They have obscure games that you might not be able to find, they have updates and support and an actual staff to call upon when shit goes down, and they offer sales and discounts and other fun stuff. 
And I don't understand why there is no such thing for films. I don't like DVD's, i think they're a little bit outdated. The closest thing is probably Netflix, but it's not available in my country.
So it's really nice to see some good movie (even if it's very short) available for online purchases. Also I like the fact that I'm paying directly to devs.
Anyway, I think this kind of (crowdfunded?) movies is the future of filmmaking.

Spectacular short sci-fi film, the best thing Blomkamp has done since District 9 and not just because it reminds us that Sigourney Weaver still kicks ass. Although it will probably make you even more mad that the director's Alien project is dead in the water, take heart that Oats Studios may deliver a far more interesting result anyway through a series of innovative shorts. Can't wait to see what they do with the next one.

You can watch this for free in stereo at 1080p, but if you buy the assets you get a downloadable version of the movie with 5.1 sound, plus various movie assets that may be expanded upon later. The main reason though is to throw a few bucks towards supporting great independent projects like this.

32545644.review:
[h1]Поддержи Бломкампа![/h1]

В интересное время всё таки живём: в то время, пока киностудии все больше отходят от чистого творчества в пользу коммерции, снимая сплошные ремейки и приквелы; начинающие и молодые режиссеры всё чаще начинают обращаться за финансированием непосредственно к аудитории (как стримеры), в надежде получить долгожданную независимость и начать снимать то, что хотят они сами, без чьей-либо указки.

Одним из таких режиссеров стал Нил Бломкамп, создавший свою экспериментальную студию и выпустивший эксклюзивно для Steam короткометражный фильм "Oats Studios - Volume 1- Rakka", который доступен в двух вариантах: бесплатный и платный. "Oats Studios - Volume 1 Assets" является платным вариантом (добровольный донат) с бонусами.

Что вы получаете покупая "Oats Studios - Volume 1 Assets"? Два видеофайла с короткометражным фильмом "Oats Studios - Volume 1- Rakka" в формате mp4 (один со стерео, другой с шестиканальным звуком), артбук с видеовставками, сценарий на английском языке, несколько моделей для печати на 3D-принтере в формате obj [strike](эх, если бы у меня ещё был 3D-принтер)[/strike]. Позже ещё обещают добавить саундтрек, дневники по фильму и комментарии от создателей.

Но самое главное, покупая этот продукт, вы инвестируете в творческие начинания Нила Бломкампа и независимый кинематограф. Много ли известных режиссеров решило выпускать фильмы, пускай и короткометражные, эксклюзивно для Steam? - Пока что только один и это Бломкамп. Лично я потратил 129 рублей, полный надежд, что ещё не один хороший фильм от него появится здесь.

[b]Поддержите Нила, пусть он снимает дальше![/b]

32457859.review:
ORIGINAL RAKKA REVIEW: Cool short. Some clear The Terminator influence which is fine by me! The movie is 30+ years old! I've always wanted to see more of the underground humanity horror from the original film. The filthy food, the radios and crying people in the sound design, general despair. I really support what Oats Studios is trying to achieve here. I hope that this new model of filmmaking can open avenues for both Blomkamp and the Oats team, as well as other filmmakers who may attempt to start similar companies in the future. Best of luck Oats!
 
FIREBASE UPDATE: This was just awesome. Rakka was cool... but I enjoyed Firebase on another level. The mixture/merger of supernatural and science fiction in regards to Rivergods powers was really cool. While it had some clear influences (what doesn't? And I suppose anything set in a jungle with sci fi will have Predator'ish vibes) this felt original and fresh. The visual effects, body horror, and Rivergod himself as a villian were badass. This one felt like a homerun. I'd want to see this as a feature film. 

(It was hard to get a review written for this because of the 5 minute minimum playtime rule. I had to click the launch button like 2000 times to keep the launch window ‘running’ over and over before windows explorer launched. I have now developed carpal tunnel syndrome because of my desire to review this video. UPDATED: They have now created a launcher that will run for 6 minutes in order to prevent further injury to Steam reviewers)

32453454.review:
Бломкамп, придумал очень крутую идею для распространения контента. 
 Ролик могут увидеть все желающие, но за отдельную плату вы получаете доступ к артбуку с видео вставками, сценарию, 3D моделям в формате OBJ и качественному видеофайлу короткометражки.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=947575505

 К сожалению в описании сказано что вы получаете 12Гб контента. На деле же 10 из них это два ролика 1 стерео, другой сураунд, что уже еще тот идиотизм. А 3D модели, это единственная моделька готовая для распечатке на 3D принтере.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=947626117

Даже studioADI опубликовали куда интереснее видео, чем в этом "доступе"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s8d3v_oSTfE

За 130 рублей сойдет.

32449849.review:
Great film, very excited to delve into the assets that made it. This is also a very interesting payment model and I really hope people show their support; not just for the Studio but to demonstrate that content/asset-driven monetization can work. Something like this isn't just great for the studio but also for any creators looking for affordable, high-quality assets to drive their own output. Very much looking forward to the next film and will continue to support Oats.



Note: There is no software that 'runs' here as launching just opens the folder containing the assets; thus it's very difficult to rack up the 5 minute minimum required to leave a review. This is why you see barely any reviews on this product. In case anyone is wondering, I got around it by clicking launch many hundreds of times.

32441857.review:
If you saw the free version, and I'm sure you did, then I implore you to grab this package immediately.  Not only will it support the creators in making future content, the video quality is far superior to just streaming online.  Very little to zero compression by comparison.

Also, the 5.1 audio track is a nice addition to the bonus content, as well as the INCREDIBLE concept art book.  Hopefully the soundtrack gets added to the DLC in the future!

Great job Oats Studios, I can't wait to see what else you've got in store for us.

39493343.review: I love this studios work and am interested in seeing more
